column2: This province is occupied by enemies and many precious lives have been lost.
Our enemies will pay for this...

Though the Men of the West replenish their numbers slowly, during times of plenty you can expend gold and influence to encourage young Dúnedain families to have more children. You should see results within twenty years.
No, not right now
Yes, make efforts to increase population in a random province
Yes, make the effort where my steward is located
The population in this province, with the expenditure of a great amount of wealth and influence, has grown greatly in the last 20 years.
Good tidings!
Increase the Dúnedain Population
Increase the Dwarven Population
Increase the Elven Population
Lightly populated by Dúnedain
The Dúnedain are waning in Middle-Earth, and there are few of them left in this province.
Populated by Dúnedain
This province is well settled by Dúnedain.
Densely populated by Dúnedain

In this province there are still many men of high blood, and though there may be other cities more crowded and populous, the natural gifts of the Dúnedain ensure that this land is both wealthy and well protected.
Lightly populated by Elves
The Elves are leaving Middle-Earth, and there are few of them left in this province.
Populated by Elves
This province is well settled by Elves.
Densely populated by Elves
Though not 'densely populated' in the human or orcish sense, there are a great many elves in this province and the lands are both wealthy and well guarded..
Lightly populated by dwarves
Dwarves still hold this province, but their numbers are few.
Populated by dwarves
This province is well settled by dwarves. Though not a numerous people, here at least they have the strength of numbers to protect their lands and maintain their great halls.
Densely populated by dwarves
The dwarves here are prospering, and though they will never reach the numbers that men and orcs can field, this land is well guarded and the population is steadily increasing.

Though Elves replenish their numbers slowly, during times of plenty you can expend gold and influence to encourage your people to have more children. You should see results within twenty years. NOTE: There is no point doing so in a densely populated province.

Though Dwarves replenish their numbers slowly, during times of plenty you can expend gold and influence to encourage your people to have more children. You should see results within twenty years. NOTE: There is no point doing so in a densely populated province..
There are hostile creatures in your realm, they must be purged and the threat removed. It might take a decade to destroy them fully, so it's time to send in the troops...
Yes, send them at once!
Your land has been purged of enemies, and now the time will come to settle the new wilderness with your people.
There are enemies living in your demesne who will never submit to you. It's time to send in the troops and get rid of them once and for all.
Your land has been purged of enemies, and now orcs are swarming in to settle the abandoned places.
This province is responsible for building a new colony in unsettled lands, and a large amount of treasure and troops are used for this process. Hence, a tax and levy penalty applies.
Sending Colonists.
Do you want to colonize this province? It can take up to 20 years, and one of your demesne provinces will suffer tax and levy penalties while it expends its resources in the new lands.
Yes, our people need new lands to settle.
No, not now.
This province has been colonised, and will now start paying taxes and contributing troops to your realm. The wilderness has given way to settlements, and your people will surely prosper here.
Colonise Wilderness with Dwarves
Being colonised with Dwarves

A dwarf noble is in your court. It will be extremely costly, but you can send him to convince some of his people to settle in a new province, while you start building the infrastructure and clearing the lands of enemies.
Yes, dwarves will live in this province.
This province has been settled by dwarves, who will be a valuable addition to your realm.
Being colonised with Elves

An elven noble is in your court. It will be extremely costly, but you can send him to convince some of his people to settle in a new province, while you start building the infrastructure and clearing the lands of enemies.
Yes, elves will live in this province.
This province has been settled by elves, who will be a valuable addition to your realm.
Colonize Wilderness with Halflings
Colonize Wilderness with Elves
Yes, elves will live in this province.

An elven noble is in your court. It will be extremely costly, but you can send him to convince some of his people to settle in a new province, while you start building the infrastructure and clearing the lands of enemies.
This province has been settled by elves, who will be a valuable addition to your realm.
Being colonised with Halflings
Colonise wilderness with halflings

An influential halfing is in your court. It will be very costly, but you can send him to convince some of his people to settle in a new province, while you start building the infrastructure and clearing the lands of enemies.
Yes, halflings will live in this province.
This province has been settled by halflings, who will be a valuable addition to your realm
Being colonised with Gondorian Middle Men
Being colonised with Arnorian Middle Men
Being colonised with Southrons
It will be very expensive to settle these lands with those of Dúnedain ancestry, as their numbers are few. Do you want to settle with middle men instead?
No, this province will be for the High Men.
Yes, send in some Gondorian Middle-Men.
Yes, send in some Arnorian Middle-Men.
Yes, send in some Southrons instead.
This province has been settled by Gondorian Middle Men, who will be a valuable addition to your realm.
This province has been settled by Arnorian Middle Men, who will be a valuable addition to your realm.
This province has been settled by Southrons, who will be a valuable addition to your realm.
This province has been settled by the High Men, who will be a valuable addition to your realm.
Population Increasing
Though Elves, Dúnedain, and Dwarves grow their populations slowly, in this province a lot of effort has been expended to increase the population, and within 20 years results should be shown.
